refsect2.title: GtkSettingsValue
gtk_settings_get_default ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GtkSettings object for the default GDK screen, creating it if necessary. See gtk_settings_get_for_screen().

listitem.simpara: a GtkSettings object. If there is no default screen, then returns NULL.

refsect2.title: gtk_settings_get_for_screen ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GtkSettings object for screen, creating it if necessary.

refsect2.title: gtk_rc_property_parse_color ()
refsect2.para: A GtkRcPropertyParser for use with gtk_settings_install_property_parser() or gtk_widget_class_install_style_property_parser() which parses a color given either by its name or in the form { red, green, blue } where red, green and blue are integers between 0 and 65535 or floating-point numbers between 0 and 1.

listitem.simpara: a GValue which must hold GdkColor values.
TRUE if gstring could be parsed and property_value has been set to the resulting GdkColor.

refsect2.title: gtk_rc_property_parse_enum ()
refsect2.para: A GtkRcPropertyParser for use with gtk_settings_install_property_parser() or gtk_widget_class_install_style_property_parser() which parses a single enumeration value.
The enumeration value can be specified by its name, its nickname or its numeric value. For consistency with flags parsing, the value may be surrounded by parentheses.

listitem.simpara: a GValue which must hold enum values.
TRUE if gstring could be parsed and property_value has been set to the resulting GEnumValue.

refsect2.title: gtk_rc_property_parse_flags ()
refsect2.para: A GtkRcPropertyParser for use with gtk_settings_install_property_parser() or gtk_widget_class_install_style_property_parser() which parses flags.
Flags can be specified by their name, their nickname or numerically. Multiple flags can be specified in the form "( flag1 | flag2 | ... )".

listitem.simpara: a GValue which must hold flags values.
TRUE if gstring could be parsed and property_value has been set to the resulting flags value.

refsect2.title: gtk_rc_property_parse_requisition ()
refsect2.para: A GtkRcPropertyParser for use with gtk_settings_install_property_parser() or gtk_widget_class_install_style_property_parser() which parses a requisition in the form "{ width, height }" for integers width and height.

listitem.simpara: a GValue which must hold boxed values.
TRUE if gstring could be parsed and property_value has been set to the resulting GtkRequisition.

refsect2.title: gtk_rc_property_parse_border ()
refsect2.para: A GtkRcPropertyParser for use with gtk_settings_install_property_parser() or gtk_widget_class_install_style_property_parser() which parses borders in the form "{ left, right, top, bottom }" for integers left, right, top and bottom.

listitem.simpara: a GValue which must hold boxed values.
TRUE if gstring could be parsed and property_value has been set to the resulting GtkBorder.

refsect2.title: gtk_settings_set_property_value ()
gtk_settings_set_string_property ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_settings_set_string_property (GtkSettings *settings, const gchar *name, const gchar *v_string, const gchar *origin);

refsect2.title: gtk_settings_set_long_property ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_settings_set_long_property (GtkSettings *settings, const gchar *name, glong v_long, const gchar *origin);

refsect2.title: gtk_settings_set_double_property ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_settings_set_double_property (GtkSettings *settings, const gchar *name, gdouble v_double, const gchar *origin);

refsect2.title: The "color-hash" property
refsect2.para: Holds a hash table representation of the "gtk-color-scheme" setting, mapping color names to GdkColors.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-alternative-button-order" property
refsect2.para: Whether buttons in dialogs should use the alternative button order.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-alternative-sort-arrows" property
refsect2.para: Controls the direction of the sort indicators in sorted list and tree views. By default an arrow pointing down means the column is sorted in ascending order. When set to TRUE, this order will be inverted.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-button-images" property
refsect2.para: Whether images should be shown on buttons.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-can-change-accels" property
refsect2.para: Whether menu accelerators can be changed by pressing a key over the menu item.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-color-palette" property
refsect2.para: Palette to use in the color selector.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-color-scheme" property
refsect2.para:
A palette of named colors for use in themes. The format of the string is
name1: color1 name2: color2 ...
Color names must be acceptable as identifiers in the gtkrc syntax, and color specifications must be in the format accepted by gdk_color_parse().
Note that due to the way the color tables from different sources are merged, color specifications will be converted to hexadecimal form when getting this property.

Starting with GTK+ 2.12, the entries can alternatively be separated by ';' instead of newlines:
name1: color1; name2: color2; ...

refsect2.title: The "gtk-cursor-blink" property
refsect2.para: Also see the "gtk-cursor-blink-timeout" setting, which allows more flexible control over cursor blinking.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-cursor-blink-time" property
refsect2.para: Length of the cursor blink cycle, in milliseconds.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-cursor-blink-timeout" property
refsect2.para: Time after which the cursor stops blinking, in seconds. The timer is reset after each user interaction.
Setting this to zero has the same effect as setting "gtk-cursor-blink" to FALSE.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-cursor-theme-name" property
refsect2.para: Name of the cursor theme to use, or NULL to use the default theme.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-cursor-theme-size" property
refsect2.para: Size to use for cursors, or 0 to use the default size.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-dnd-drag-threshold" property
refsect2.para: Number of pixels the cursor can move before dragging.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-double-click-distance" property
refsect2.para: Maximum distance allowed between two clicks for them to be considered a double click (in pixels).

refsect2.title: The "gtk-double-click-time" property
refsect2.para: Maximum time allowed between two clicks for them to be considered a double click (in milliseconds).

refsect2.title: The "gtk-enable-accels" property
refsect2.para: Whether menu items should have visible accelerators which can be activated.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-enable-event-sounds" property
refsect2.para: Whether to play any event sounds at all.
See the Sound Theme spec for more information on event sounds and sound themes.
GTK+ itself does not support event sounds, you have to use a loadable module like the one that comes with libcanberra.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-enable-input-feedback-sounds" property
refsect2.para: Whether to play event sounds as feedback to user input.
See the Sound Theme spec for more information on event sounds and sound themes.
GTK+ itself does not support event sounds, you have to use a loadable module like the one that comes with libcanberra.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-enable-mnemonics" property
refsect2.para: Whether labels and menu items should have visible mnemonics which can be activated.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-enable-tooltips" property
refsect2.para: Whether tooltips should be shown on widgets.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-entry-password-hint-timeout" property
refsect2.para: How long to show the last input character in hidden entries. This value is in milliseconds. 0 disables showing the last char. 600 is a good value for enabling it.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-entry-select-on-focus" property
refsect2.para: Whether to select the contents of an entry when it is focused.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-error-bell" property
refsect2.para: When TRUE, keyboard navigation and other input-related errors will cause a beep. Since the error bell is implemented using gdk_window_beep(), the windowing system may offer ways to configure the error bell in many ways, such as flashing the window or similar visual effects.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-fallback-icon-theme" property
refsect2.para: Name of a icon theme to fall back to.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-file-chooser-backend" property
refsect2.para: Name of the GtkFileChooser backend to use by default.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-font-name" property
refsect2.para: Name of default font to use.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-icon-sizes" property
refsect2.para: A list of icon sizes. The list is separated by colons, and item has the form:

E.g. "gtk-menu=16,16:gtk-button=20,20:gtk-dialog=48,48". GTK+ itself use the following named icon sizes: gtk-menu, gtk-button, gtk-small-toolbar, gtk-large-toolbar, gtk-dnd, gtk-dialog. Applications can register their own named icon sizes with gtk_icon_size_register().

refsect2.title: The "gtk-icon-theme-name" property
refsect2.para: Name of icon theme to use.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-im-module" property
refsect2.para: Which IM (input method) module should be used by default. This is the input method that will be used if the user has not explicitly chosen another input method from the IM context menu.
See GtkIMContext and see the "gtk-show-input-method-menu" property.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-key-theme-name" property
refsect2.para: Name of key theme RC file to load.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-keynav-cursor-only" property
refsect2.para: When TRUE, keyboard navigation should be able to reach all widgets by using the cursor keys only. Tab, Shift etc. keys can't be expected to be present on the used input device.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-keynav-wrap-around" property
refsect2.para: When TRUE, some widgets will wrap around when doing keyboard navigation, such as menus, menubars and notebooks.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-label-select-on-focus" property
refsect2.para: Whether to select the contents of a selectable label when it is focused.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-menu-bar-accel" property
refsect2.para: Keybinding to activate the menu bar.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-menu-bar-popup-delay" property
refsect2.para: Delay before the submenus of a menu bar appear.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-menu-images" property
refsect2.para: Whether images should be shown in menus.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-menu-popdown-delay" property
refsect2.para: The time before hiding a submenu when the pointer is moving towards the submenu.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-menu-popup-delay" property
refsect2.para: Minimum time the pointer must stay over a menu item before the submenu appear.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-modules" property
refsect2.para: List of currently active GTK modules.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-print-backends" property
refsect2.para: A comma-separated list of print backends to use in the print dialog. Available print backends depend on the GTK+ installation, and may include "pdf", "cups" or "lpr".

refsect2.title: The "gtk-print-preview-command" property
refsect2.para: A command to run for displaying the print preview. The command should contain a f placeholder, which will get replaced by the path to the pdf file. The command may also contain a s placeholder, which will get replaced by the path to a file containing the print settings in the format produced by gtk_print_settings_to_file().
The preview application is responsible for removing the pdf file and the print settings file when it is done.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-recent-files-limit" property
refsect2.para: The number of recently used files that should be displayed by default by GtkRecentChooser implementations and by the GtkFileChooser. A value of -1 means every recently used file stored.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-recent-files-max-age" property
refsect2.para: The maximum age, in days, of the items inside the recently used resources list. Items older than this setting will be excised from the list. If set to 0, the list will always be empty; if set to -1, no item will be removed.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-scrolled-window-placement" property
refsect2.para: Where the contents of scrolled windows are located with respect to the scrollbars, if not overridden by the scrolled window's own placement.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-show-input-method-menu" property
refsect2.para: Whether the context menus of entries and text views should offer to change the input method.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-show-unicode-menu" property
refsect2.para: Whether the context menus of entries and text views should offer to insert control characters.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-sound-theme-name" property
refsect2.para: The XDG sound theme to use for event sounds.
See the Sound Theme spec for more information on event sounds and sound themes.
GTK+ itself does not support event sounds, you have to use a loadable module like the one that comes with libcanberra.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-split-cursor" property
refsect2.para: Whether two cursors should be displayed for mixed left-to-right and right-to-left text.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-theme-name" property
refsect2.para: Name of theme RC file to load.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-timeout-expand" property
refsect2.para: Expand value for timeouts, when a widget is expanding a new region.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-timeout-initial" property
refsect2.para: Starting value for timeouts, when button is pressed.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-timeout-repeat" property
refsect2.para: Repeat value for timeouts, when button is pressed.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-toolbar-icon-size" property
refsect2.para: Size of icons in default toolbars.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-toolbar-style" property
refsect2.para: Whether default toolbars have text only, text and icons, icons only, etc.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-tooltip-browse-mode-timeout" property
refsect2.para: Amount of time, in milliseconds, after which the browse mode will be disabled.
See "gtk-tooltip-browse-timeout" for more information about browse mode.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-tooltip-browse-timeout" property
refsect2.para: Controls the time after which tooltips will appear when browse mode is enabled, in milliseconds.

Browse mode is enabled when the mouse pointer moves off an object where a tooltip was currently being displayed. If the mouse pointer hits another object before the browse mode timeout expires (see "gtk-tooltip-browse-mode-timeout"), it will take the amount of milliseconds specified by this setting to popup the tooltip for the new object.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-tooltip-timeout" property
refsect2.para: Time, in milliseconds, after which a tooltip could appear if the cursor is hovering on top of a widget.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-touchscreen-mode" property
refsect2.para: When TRUE, there are no motion notify events delivered on this screen, and widgets can't use the pointer hovering them for any essential functionality.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-xft-dpi" property
refsect2.para: Resolution for Xft, in 1024 * dots/inch. -1 to use default value.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-xft-hintstyle" property
refsect2.para: What degree of hinting to use; hintnone, hintslight, hintmedium, or hintfull.

refsect2.title: The "gtk-xft-rgba" property
refsect2.para: Type of subpixel antialiasing; none, rgb, bgr, vrgb, vbgr.
